intro: Dyschoriste perrottetii, commonly known as the African horned vulture plant, is a member of the Apocynaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its striking, spiky leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or red and attract pollinators such as birds and insects. Dyschoriste perrottetii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
